data.title: Great little place
data.text:
This is a wonderful little place a bit off the beaten track.  It's located in a  former "Sears and Roebuck catalogue house".  Older readers can recall a time when you could order a house through their catalogue (long before online shopping) and it would be delivered to your site and assembled.
The food here is authentic Lebanese as are most of the servers.  We were a party of five and we told them we wanted everything family style so we could all taste the wonderful flavors.  The baba ganuus was delicious as was their house special chicken.

data.title: Good Time
data.text: We remembered this place years ago when it was in Richardson. The food, service, and atmosphere were all great. It is a little pricey so we use it on special occasions.

data.title: Want to try something exotic?
data.text: We don't have a lot of experience eating Mediterranean food, but we tried this recently.  It turned out we knew our server from another restaurant.  So the service was excellent.  He was very attentive and friendly.  He recommended some dishes and they were very good.  Try it next time you want something different.

data.title: Great food!
data.text: Great food that doesn't make you feel gross after eating. Very flavorful. Grow ingredients outside in garden. Bring hot pita bread fresh to your table. Got the trio to eat with pita bread and it was delicious. Hedary's chicken was amazing. Definitely recommend. The restaurant is also BYOB.

data.title: great food and service!
data.text:
Just went here for the first time a few weeks ago and I was blown away by the customer service. Super friendly and very informative! 

The food was amazing and they're not stingy on the pita bread! A+++ in my book, definitely my new favorite place.

data.title: Unexpected Excellence
data.text: We hadn't planned to go out to eat tonight, but the AC went out in our house, and we decided to go out of town to a hotel to get out of the 100 degree heat inside and decided to go to McKinney.  While looking in Trip Advisor - we found " Hedary's Mediterranean Grill" listed in nearby Allen and decided to give it a try.  It was a short drive from the Sheraton and we easily found the pink house like structure housing the restaurant, There was a nice garden outside, where fresh herbs, tomatoes, squash, zucchini etc was growing. We were warmly greeted by Betty, who seated us in one of the many small dining rooms.  We decided to try the "Mezza" platter - which had about 20 small dishes of just about every type of Middle Eastern  dip and appetizer imaginable.  A large bowl of fantastic home made bread was also brought to the table.  This was way more than I expected, and was much more than enough for the 4 of us. As for the main courses, we had Kibbee - 2 stuffed meatballs served with a very aromatic rice, plus grilled tomatoes. Son ordered a combination meat plate that featured large portions of beef, lamb, chicken vegetables and rice served in a kabob style. He gave it 5 stars.  Grandson ordered a mediteranean pizza with cheese, fresh, basil and tomatoes. He said was the best he had ever had.  Forgot he also ordered a mozzarella, tomato and fresh basil salad, which was like a Caprese Salad and he ate it all.  I ordered the Hedary Special Chicken platter - a half chicken, perfectly grilled and and served in a creamy lemon based sauce with roasted potatoes, sweet potatoes and some other vegetables I am was not familiar with, but were outstanding. Everyone except me ordered iced tea, which they said was fine, I ordered Turkish coffee - kind of like an expresso, and it was ok - nothing special  No alcohol is served at the restaurant, but I saw people bringing in their own wine.  I very much recommend this restaurant for its food quality, decor, ambience and extremely friendly and attentive service. Can't wait to go again. Thanks, Betty, chef and management for a wonderful meal.  PS - it was our anniversary.

data.title: Good Persian Food
data.text: This is a surprise gem in a historic setting off the beaten path.  The staff is great and very attentive and the food is authentic and very good.  Anyone that has ever gone there with us loved it!

data.title: So Delicious!!!
data.text: I've been coming here for the past few years, and the food is always amazing.  George, the chef, grows his own produce out front and really takes pride in his art.  The owner will even play his accordion sometimes :).  I have gone here with my large family and also just my wife and I, and each and every time the experience has been wonderful.  This is a BYOB which makes it even better!  Every item on the menu has been extremely tasty, I can't recommend Hedary's Allen any stronger.

data.title: Delicious lunch
data.text: We had lunch at Hedary's while visiting the Dallas area.  I'm so happy that we stumbled on to this restaurant.  The food was delicious, the ambiance was cozy and the service was wonderful.  I can't wait until our next visit.

data.title: Love the food and venue
data.text: I love Mediterranean food and everything here is great.  It is in an older home, which I love, but possibly not for everyone.  All ingredients are fresh and love the variety offered.  Very friendly staff and owner has been present when I have visited.  A welcome change from the chain restaurants in this area.

data.title: Good Mediterranean dishes
data.text: We stopped here for dinner after passing by on the way to shopping. We decided to come back and try it. The restaurant is located in an old home that has been re-purposed. The food here is authentic Mediterranean style. I had the gyro and it was really good. For dessert we had baklava and it was flaky and delicious.

data.title: Great Lebanese food!
data.text: A little like dining in someone's home - it is actually a 1904 Sears & Roebuck home with a wrap-around porch. There are separate rooms and a bar - so it can accommodate meetings or soirees. The bread is too good to pass up and the food is well prepared and delicious. Only misgiving is that the wait staff can be a bit aloof - since they are all separate rooms, you may not even see your wait staff until they happen by.

data.title: Valentine's Day with the wife
data.text: My wife and I went here on Valentine's Day. We had never been to a Lebanese Restaurant before so I wasn't really familiar with the cuisine. LOL I really couldn't pronounce anything on the menu but our server was gracious enough to explain everything and make suggestions. The meal was excellent and the service superb. Will go again on another date night.

data.title: Wonderful family owned place with best food
data.text: We love this restaurant, food is always great, service is great and staff is friendly. This place has a great feel, it is BOYB and has outdoor seating as well and tacked away in a quite corner. The appetizer plater is very delicious. We have tried almost everything and never been disappointed. Highly recommended.

data.title: Average at best
data.text: Everything was good but nothing was great. We started with a meeza sampler. Gave us a little of everything which was a great start to the meal. Main courses were lamb chops for me which were small, raw and only came with rice because I requested it. Wife had there sampler which came with 2 sausages and a meatball all of it tasted the same. Mother had the chicken which had a great sauce and root vegetables on it but the chicken was excessively over cooked and dry. We expected a lot more with the reviews that it received. We will continue to go to better options in Dallas.

data.title: One-of-a-kind, homey Lebanese restaurant
data.text: This restaurant in Allen opened in a cute early 20th century home a little over four years ago.  The first time that I came to the restaurant I was delighted by the garden outside.  As I walked up the path I saw vegetables being grown - tomatoes, cucumbers, eggplants, herbs - and I knew that the food would be special.  After my meal there I was thinking how great it would be to have my relatives (we are half Lebanese and full Lebanese) come enjoy a meal there.  Well, the next year, my son announced his engagement so I planned a pre-wedding dinner in one of the rooms at Hedary's.  I was a little nervous because many members of my family are world travelers  and discriminating gourmets but they raved about Hedary's food and said that it was the best they had ever had!  Whenever someone asks me where to dine in the area, I recommend Hedary's.  The owner is always there, as is a personable waiter that we like. The pocket bread is made after the diners arrive and is placed on the table warm from the oven; it is irresistible!  This is a long post to say that I highly recommend Hedary's; it is my favorite area restaurant. Last week I brought co-workers to the restaurant and they were so pleased! Oh, and by the way, I like restaurants that offer outdoor eating and Hedary's has many tables outside on their expansive porch.

data.title: Privately owned. Great food. Cozy.
data.text: Very nice, small and cozy restaurant located in an old house in downtown Allen. The food is  fresh and delicious. The turkish coffee and baklava are to die for! You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Nice surprise in the center of town.
data.text: This nice place close to the center of town, close to everything. Very nice atmosphere, which is great for a family or a nice dinner for two. Or a group of friends that enjoy great Mediterranean ..Greek food at a reasonable price......what more could anyone want. Great food, great service, location right off main st....

data.title: Great food.
data.text: I always enjoy the food here. The Hedary's Chicken and pizza is always good. My family and I always prefer to skip most chain restaurants and east at small places like this. They even grown their own herbs.

data.title: Nice restaurant!
data.text:
The restaurant itself in in a quaint old house in East Allen.  During the summer, they grow many of their own herbs and vegetables.  The food is really fresh and good.  I just love the atmosphere here.  The owner is really nice and personally checks that you are satisfied wit the food.

We've been here several times and will always come back for more!
